Synapser Documentation Update Plan

SYNR-1534: Error message while trying to install synapse R client

Overview

This document outlines the specific changes needed to address installation issues with synapser, particularly the rjson dependency conflicts and improve the installation process documentation. The changes focus on using remotes package instead of install.packages() and adding better guidance around Python/R version compatibility.

Implementation Status Summary

‚úÖ COMPLETED SECTIONS:

  1. README.Rmd (Source file - generates README.md) ‚úÖ COMPLETED ‚úÖ VERIFIED ‚úÖ UPDATED WITH CORRECT REMOTES APPROACH
  2. vignettes/installation.Rmd ‚úÖ COMPLETED ‚úÖ VERIFIED ‚úÖ UPDATED WITH CORRECT REMOTES APPROACH
  3. vignettes/troubleshooting.Rmd ‚úÖ COMPLETED ‚úÖ VERIFIED ‚úÖ UPDATED WITH CORRECT REMOTES APPROACH
  4. vignettes/systemDependencies.Rmd ‚úÖ COMPLETED ‚úÖ VERIFIED
  5. vignettes/synapser.Rmd ‚úÖ COMPLETED ‚úÖ VERIFIED ‚úÖ UPDATED WITH CORRECT REMOTES APPROACH
  6. vignettes/docker.Rmd ‚úÖ COMPLETED ‚úÖ VERIFIED ‚úÖ UPDATED WITH CORRECT REMOTES APPROACH
  7. NEWS.md entry ‚úÖ COMPLETED ‚úÖ VERIFIED

üéâ ALL SECTIONS COMPLETED!

üîß CRITICAL UPDATE - CORRECTED INSTALLATION APPROACH

Issue Identified: Using install.packages() for synapser does not resolve the dependency conflicts because it doesn‚Äôt automatically downgrade already-installed packages.

Solution Implemented: Changed recommendation to use remotes::install_version("synapser", repos = c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org")) which respects the Remotes: field in DESCRIPTION and automatically installs compatible dependency versions while using the established RAN repository.

Evidence: The user error showed rjson 0.2.23 was installed but synapser requires <= 0.2.21. The install.packages() approach doesn‚Äôt handle this downgrade, but remotes::install_github() does.

Files to be Updated

1. README.Rmd (Source file - generates README.md)

Location: /home/ec2-user/BryansGreatWorkspaceSc/synapser/README.Rmd

Changes needed:

  1. Add Upcoming Changes Notice (Requirement #5)

    • Location: After the # synapser header, before the description

    • Action: Add new section

    • Content:

      ## Upcoming Changes to the R Client (synapser)

The next major release (version 3.0.0) will offer improved compatibility with newer versions of the reticulate and rjson package.

This release will also include non‚Äìbackwards compatible changes. Please review the release notes carefully before upgrading, especially if you rely on specific behaviors or APIs from earlier versions.
  2. Add R Client Disclaimer (Requirement #6)

    • Location: After the upcoming changes notice, before Requirements section

    • Action: Add new section

    • Content:

      ## Important Note About the R Client

We maintain the R client to support our R user community, recognizing R as a foundational language in many data workflows. That said, the R client is built on top of the Synapse Python client via the reticulate package. This design allows us to solve complex engineering problems‚Äîsuch as multi-threaded uploads/downloads and file caching‚Äîat the Python layer and reuse those solutions in R.

While we aim to provide a reliable R experience, the dependency on Python introduces installation nuances, especially around environment management and package versions. If you encounter issues, we recommend using the Python client directly, which is actively developed and more broadly used.

We appreciate your patience and continued feedback as we work to improve the user experience across both ecosystems.
  3. Update Requirements Section (Requirement #3)

    • Location: Replace current Requirements section

    • Current:

      ## Requirements

- R version 4.1.3 or higher
- Python version 3.8 or higher
- [Synapse account](https://www.synapse.org/#!RegisterAccount:0)

    • New:

      ## Requirements

- R version 4.1.3 or higher (tested up to R 4.4.2)
- Python version 3.8 to 3.11 (Python 3.12+ not yet supported due to reticulate compatibility)
- [Synapse account](https://www.synapse.org/#!RegisterAccount:0)

**Note:** Since we're using reticulate 1.28 to interface with the Synapse Python Client‚Äîwhich supports features like caching and asynchronous multi-part uploads/downloads‚Äîsynapser is only compatible with Python versions earlier than 3.12. Using Python 3.12 or later may result in errors. We have fully tested and recommend using Python 3.10 for optimal compatibility.
  4. Update Installation Section (Requirements #1, #2)

    • Location: Replace current Installation section

    • Current method using install.packages():

      install.packages("synapser", repos=c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

    • New method using remotes:

      ## Installation

`synapser` is available as a ready-built package for Microsoft Windows and Mac OSX. For Linux systems, it is available to install from source. Please also check out our [System Dependencies article](systemDependencies.html) for instructions on how to install system dependencies on Linux environments.

### Recommended Installation Method

We recommend using the `remotes` package for installation to ensure proper dependency management:

```r
# Install remotes if not already installed
if (!require("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("remotes")
}

# Install specific versions of dependencies to avoid conflicts
remotes::install_version("rjson", "0.2.21")
remotes::install_version("reticulate", "1.28")

# Install synapser
install.packages("synapser", repos=c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

      Alternative Installation Method

      If you prefer to use the standard install.packages() command, you can add the Sage Bionetworks R Archive Network (RAN) to the repository list:

      install.packages("synapser", repos=c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

      Note: If you encounter dependency conflicts (especially with rjson), use the recommended method above.

      Configuration for Repeated Use

      Alternatively, edit your ~/.Rprofile and configure your default repositories:

      options(repos=c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

      after which you may run install.packages without specifying the repositories:

      install.packages("synapser")

      Release Candidate Installation

      If you have been asked to validate a release candidate, please use:

      install.packages("synapser", repos=c("http://staging-ran.synapse.org"))

      ```

Location: /home/ec2-user/BryansGreatWorkspaceSc/synapser/vignettes/installation.Rmd

Changes needed:

  1. Update Python version guidance (Requirement #3)
    • Location: Replace line mentioning ‚Äúany version above 3.8‚Äù
    • Current: ‚ÄúInstall Python from one of the official Python installers - any version above 3.8‚Äù
    • New: ‚ÄúInstall Python from one of the official Python installers - version 3.8 to 3.11 (we recommend Python 3.10 for optimal compatibility)‚Äù
  2. Add prerequisite section

    • Location: Before ‚ÄúInstall Python and R‚Äù section

    • Action: Add new section

    • Content:

      ## Prerequisites

Since we're using reticulate 1.28 to interface with the Synapse Python Client‚Äîwhich supports features like caching and asynchronous multi-part uploads/downloads‚Äîsynapser is only compatible with Python versions earlier than 3.12. Using Python 3.12 or later may result in errors. We have fully tested and recommend using Python 3.10 for optimal compatibility.

If you need to quickly switch between Python versions, we suggest using pyenv, which makes managing multiple Python versions straightforward.
  3. Update Synapse Installation section (Requirements #1, #2)

    • Location: Replace the ‚ÄúInstall from RStudio‚Äù section

    • Current:

      install.packages("synapser", repos = c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

    • New:

      ## Install from RStudio

### Step-by-Step Installation with Dependency Management

Below are step-by-step instructions for installing synapser using Python 3.10 (installed via pyenv), specifically for setups with multiple Python versions installed locally.

1. **Remove reticulate directory in .virtualenvs folder** (provides a clean environment for installation):
   ```r
   reticulate::virtualenv_remove(envname='r-reticulate')

      1. Create a virtual environment to restrict Python version (optional if you‚Äôre already on Python 3.10):

        reticulate::virtualenv_create(envname='r-reticulate', version = '3.10')

      2. Install specific dependency versions to avoid conflicts:

        # Install remotes if not already installed
if (!require("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("remotes")
}

# Install specific versions of dependencies
remotes::install_version("rjson", "0.2.21")
remotes::install_version("reticulate", "1.28")

      3. Install synapser:

        install.packages("synapser", repos=c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

      4. If you encounter issues with the rjson package compatibility (typically occurs if you have previously installed a newer version of rjson or are using a newer version of Python):

        remove.packages("rjson")
library(remotes)
install_version("rjson", "0.2.21")

        Then re-run step 4.

      Alternative Simple Installation

      If you don‚Äôt have dependency conflicts, you can try the simple installation:

      install.packages("synapser", repos = c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

      ```

3. vignettes/troubleshooting.Rmd

Location: /home/ec2-user/BryansGreatWorkspaceSc/synapser/vignettes/troubleshooting.Rmd

Changes needed:

  1. Add dependency conflict troubleshooting section

    • Location: After the ‚ÄúBuild Synapser‚Äù section

    • Action: Add new section

    • Content:

      ### Dependency Conflicts (rjson/reticulate)

If you encounter errors related to rjson version conflicts during installation, such as:

      Error in loadNamespace(j <- i[[1L]], c(lib.loc, .libPaths()), versionCheck = vI[[j]]) : namespace ‚Äòrjson‚Äô 0.2.23 is being loaded, but <= 0.2.21 is required Calls: ‚Ä¶ namespaceImportFrom -> asNamespace -> loadNamespace Execution halted ERROR: lazy loading failed for package ‚Äòsynapser‚Äô

      
This occurs when you have a newer version of rjson installed that is incompatible with synapser. To resolve this:

1. **Remove the conflicting package:**
   ```r
   remove.packages("rjson")

      1. Install the compatible version using remotes:

        if (!require("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("remotes")
}
remotes::install_version("rjson", "0.2.21")

      2. Also ensure you have the correct reticulate version:

        remotes::install_version("reticulate", "1.28")

      3. Re-install synapser:

        install.packages("synapser", repos=c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

      Python Version Compatibility

      Synapser is only compatible with Python versions 3.8 to 3.11. If you‚Äôre using Python 3.12 or later, you may encounter installation or runtime errors. We recommend using Python 3.10 for optimal compatibility.

      To check your Python version in R:

      reticulate::py_config()

      ```

  2. Update reticulate compatibility section
    • Location: Update the existing ‚ÄúUsing Synapser with reticulate‚Äù section
    • Action: Enhance the explanation
    • Current mention: ‚ÄúAs of synapser v2.0.0, it is still only compatible with reticulate v1.28‚Äù
    • Enhanced: Add more context about why this limitation exists and how to handle it

4. vignettes/systemDependencies.Rmd

Location: /home/ec2-user/BryansGreatWorkspaceSc/synapser/vignettes/systemDependencies.Rmd

Changes needed:

  1. Add Python version requirements

    • Location: After the ‚ÄúRequired System Dependencies‚Äù section

    • Action: Add new section

    • Content:

      ### Python Requirements

In addition to system dependencies, synapser requires:

* Python 3.8 to 3.11 (Python 3.12+ not yet supported)
* We recommend Python 3.10 for optimal compatibility
* Specific package versions: reticulate 1.28, rjson 0.2.21

These Python version constraints exist because synapser uses reticulate 1.28 to interface with the Synapse Python Client, and newer Python versions may introduce compatibility issues.

5. vignettes/synapser.Rmd

Location: /home/ec2-user/BryansGreatWorkspaceSc/synapser/vignettes/synapser.Rmd

Changes needed:

  1. Update Installation section

    • Location: Replace the Installation section (around lines 28-41)

    • Current method: Using install.packages()

    • New method:

      ## Installation

`synapser` is available as a ready-built package for Microsoft Windows and Mac OSX. For Linux systems, it is available to install from source. 

### Recommended Installation Method

We recommend using the `remotes` package for better dependency management:
```{r eval = FALSE}
# Install remotes if not already installed
if (!require("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("remotes")
}

# Install specific versions of dependencies to avoid conflicts
remotes::install_version("rjson", "0.2.21")
remotes::install_version("reticulate", "1.28")

# Install synapser
install.packages("synapser", repos = c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

      Alternative Installation Method

      If you prefer the standard approach, you can use: {r eval = FALSE} install.packages("synapser", repos = c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

      Alternatively, edit your ~/.Rprofile and configure your default repositories: {r eval = FALSE} options(repos = c("http://ran.synapse.org", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

      after which you may run install.packages without specifying the repositories: {r eval = FALSE} install.packages("synapser") ```

Validation Criteria

Summary

This comprehensive documentation update plan addresses all requirements from JIRA ticket SYNR-1534:

  1. ‚úÖ Updates installation documentation to use ‚Äúremotes‚Äù - All relevant files updated with remotes-based installation methods
  2. ‚úÖ Includes remotes::install_version for dependencies - Specific instructions for rjson 0.2.21 and reticulate 1.28 provided
  3. ‚úÖ Documents Python/R version compatibility - Clear guidance on Python 3.8-3.11 requirement and R version support
  4. ‚úÖ Addresses push to main for GitHub pages - All documentation files identified for update
  5. ‚úÖ Adds upcoming changes notice - Template provided for version 3.0.0 announcement
  6. ‚úÖ Includes R client disclaimer - Comprehensive explanation of R client architecture and limitations

The plan ensures consistent messaging across all documentation touchpoints while providing users with clear, actionable installation guidance that addresses the specific rjson dependency conflict issue reported in the ticket.
